metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6812 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
The first time AirPods are connected to an iPhone, they become named after the user's name by default (e.g. Jane Doe's AirPods.) Websites with camera or microphone permission are able to enumerate device names, disclosing the user's name. To resolve this issue, Firefox added a special case that renames devices containing the substring 'AirPods' to simply 'AirPods'. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.6, Firefox < 74, Firefox < ESR68.6, and Firefox ESR < 68.6.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-6812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '74.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
